answers.answer: I think my outbreaks usually lasted a few days like with the physical sore present but I'm actually not sure how long like the virus itself stays shedding. I would think 1-2 weeks maybe? That's a good question. . Hmm?
If it isn't an outbreak ,the burning could be a possible infection like bacterial vaginosis or yeast infection.They are very commom during pregnancy.

Yeah I don't think it's an outbreak either because a bump or blister is one of the first indicators. It does sound like bv or a yeast infection. Just ask your doctor about it to start treatment before baby comes
Oh well that would be amazing if it wasnt one. Do they usually have blisters right away?
Not blisters right away, but a small bump that's slightly itchy is always the first thing I notice. Sure enough, whether I scratch or not, it turns into the sore :(
So as soon as I notice that, I start the acyclovir.
Ya see I never noticed a thing until last night when going potty. Dr did check my cervix yesterday idk if that could have irritated anything?
Is it likely to have an outbreak when taking antivirals to prevent?  Could I double up on it now just to be safe its gone if is a small outbreak?
Maybe so.. but don't stress about it because the stress could trigger the outbreak!

question: Hello, so I am 37 wks pregnant and being induced in 4 days because of mild preeclampsia.  I have only had one outbreak and that was 7 years ago.  I have been on 500mg valtrex for the past 3 wks to avoid any obreak.  Yesterday while going to the bathroom I noticed some burning. It is still there today but no blisters or sores just looks a little read.  If it is a obreak how long does a recurrent one typically last? Ive been on antivirals for wks so id be suprised if it is one? Any help appreciated as I don't kno what to do
title: 37 wks and poss herpes outbreak
